Articles.Content: Cant get the Kerbalizer to work on the KSP website. I paid for it long ago and haven't used it in a while. However went on there today and once it loads it's simply black on white Silhouette of the editor and doesn't respond to selection at all, nor is there any models displayed. Yes, I have the most current version of unity and web player. Wonder if anyone else is having this issue and if there's a fix or is it just the application itself?
I can confirm it's not working. I'll relay this to Alex as soon as Squad comes online again
For me itÃ‚Â´s still not working and my support message did not get any replay. But they are still selling it.. so i guess it should work...otherwise......
Kerbalizer doesn't have much purpose. It'd be cool if they extended the Pro version greatly, with custom animations, walk cycles, etc, even a way to 3D print your custom Kerbals!
Yeah, wasn`t working for me the other day either. If it does get working, could there be something in the forum letting us know please?
It's a weird issue, but I have found a workaround: rightclick the unity web player when it's done loading, go fullscreen then exit fullscreen again. App works as expected (at least for me).
I had an issue with Kerbalizer not launching...actually it was due to"Adblock Plus" chrome plugin.

I don't use AdBlock or Chrome. When i first purchased it. it worked fine. But now i haven't been able to use it in more than 6 months. Squad...I paid for this application. why not fix it? especially if your still selling it.

I don't use AdBlock or Chrome. When i first purchased it. it worked fine. But now i haven't been able to use it in more than 6 months. Squad...I paid for this application. why not fix it? especially if your still selling it.

Ok, Update... I did get it working using the "go full screen" and then "minimizing" and then restoring it to full screen. This worked for me. I use Unity all the time and keep it updated...I wonder if it's just because my Unity player may be a more current version than what the Browser uses? Don't know...but i know it takes it a while to load ...about twice as long as when i initially purchased it.

The Unity Web Player and the standalone Unity builds you can get for desktop development are entirely separate pieces of software, if that's what you mean.

And it's going to take a while to load around now, because everyone's still busy downloading 0.90, bogging the servers down.
